text:
```jsx resumeInHtmlToPDF/src/App.jsx import { MdEmail, MdLocationPin, MdCall } from "react-icons/md"; import { TbWorldWww } from "react-icons/tb"; import { FaLanguage } from "react-icons/fa"; import { workExperince as exp, skills } from "./importedInfo"; function App() { return (

Abo Shaar

  • Title: Frontend Developer
  • Years of Experience: 2
  • Birthdate: 30. July 2001
    Contact:
  • housein.aboshaar@gmail.com
  • houseinaboshaar.com
    Location:
  • Columbusgasse 11, 1100,
    Vienna, Austria
    Languages:
  • English Fluent, C2
  • German Proficient, C1
  • Arabic Native
  • Russian Elementary

Work Experience:

{exp.map((ex, index) => ( <>
{ex.startDate} {ex.endDate} - 
{ex.company}
{ex.location}
{ex.title}
{ex.description}
))}

Skills and Competencies:

{skills.map((domain, index) => ( <>

{domain.title} {domain.level && ` - ${domain.level}`}:

    {domain.tools}
))}
); } export default App; ``` ```jsx resumeInHtmlToPDF/src/importedInfo.jsx export const workExperince = [ { title: "Frontend Developer", company: "FONDS professionell", location: "Vienna, Austria", startDate: "since", endDate: "03/2023", description: "I always knew that I had a passion and strong affinity for programming, which I finally got to pursue with this job. Although I was mainly hired as a frontend developer and to create and manage web applications and graphic designs, I also had the opportunity to work on backend tasks such as Database Management, Data Analysis, and task automations.", }, { title: "Mechatronics technician", company: "Enpulsion GmbH", location: "Wiener Neustadt, Lower Austria", startDate: "09/2021 - ", endDate: "09/2023", description: "This is where I got to accomplish one of my greatest achievements in my career, making something that is destined for outer space. Although I only began as apprentice, I proved my competence and work ethic which led to me being hired as a full-time technician. My tasks included maintinance of production machines, assembly of components, testing prototypes, monitoring and writing scripts, and authoring documentation.", }, { title: "Mechatronics Apprentice", company: "BIFI", location: "Vienna, Austria", startDate: "09/2021 - ", endDate: "09/2023", description: "Entered the workforce with a Mechatronics Apprenticeship at BIFI in Vienna", }, ]; export const skills = [ { title: "Frontend", level: "Advanced", tools: ["Javascript, TailwindCSS, React, HTML, CSS."], }, { title: "Backend", level: "Basic", tools: ["Php, mySQL, Python, Vite."], }, { title: "Design", level: "Advanced", tools: ["Photoshop, Illustrator, Figma."], }, { title: "Miscellaneous", tools: ["Git, Gitlab, Bash, Linux, Lua."] }, ]; ``` can you turn all the static info in the app.jsx into imported info from the importedInfo.jsx? for example, contact would be import {Contact} from './importedInfo.jsx'; and so on. I'll help you restructure your code to move all the static information from `App.jsx` to `importedInfo.jsx`. Let's refactor both files: First, let's update the `importedInfo.jsx` file to include all the static information: ```jsx // importedInfo.jsx export const personalInfo = { name: "Housein Abo Shaar", title: "Frontend Developer", yearsOfExperience: 2, birthdate: "30. July 2001", image: "./src/assets/myImg.png" }; export const contact = { email: "housein.aboshaar@gmail.com", website: "https://houseinaboshaar.com", phone: "+43 676 6610280" }; export const location = { address: "Columbusgasse 11, 1100, Vienna, Austria" }; export const languages = [ { language: "English", level: "Fluent, C2" }, { language: "German", level: "Proficient, C1" }, { language: "Arabic", level: "Native" }, { language: "Russian", level: "Elementary" } ]; export const workExperince = [ { title: "Frontend Developer", company: "FONDS professionell", location: "Vienna, Austria", startDate: "since", endDate: "03/2023", description: "I always knew that I had a passion and strong affinity for programming, which I finally got to pursue with this job. Although I was mainly hired as a frontend developer and to create and manage web applications and graphic designs, I also had the opportunity to work on backend tasks such as Database Management, Data Analysis, and task automations.", }, { title: "Mechatronics technician", company: "Enpulsion GmbH", location: "Wiener Neustadt, Lower Austria", startDate: "09/2021 - ", endDate: "09/2023", description: "This is where I got to accomplish one of my greatest achievements in my career, making something that is destined for outer space. Although I only began as apprentice, I proved my competence and work ethic which led to me being hired as a full-time technician. My tasks included maintinance of production machines, assembly of components, testing prototypes, monitoring and writing scripts, and authoring documentation.", }, { title: "Mechatronics Apprentice", company: "BIFI", location: "Vienna, Austria", startDate: "09/2021 - ", endDate: "09/2023", description: "Entered the workforce with a Mechatronics Apprenticeship at BIFI in Vienna", }, ]; export const skills = [ { title: "Frontend", level: "Advanced", tools: ["Javascript, TailwindCSS, React, HTML, CSS."], }, { title: "Backend", level: "Basic", tools: ["Php, mySQL, Python, Vite."], }, { title: "Design", level: "Advanced", tools: ["Photoshop, Illustrator, Figma."], }, { title: "Miscellaneous", tools: ["Git, Gitlab, Bash, Linux, Lua."] }, ]; ``` Now, let's update the `App.jsx` file to import and use this information: ```jsx // App.jsx import { MdEmail, MdLocationPin, MdCall } from "react-icons/md"; import { TbWorldWww } from "react-icons/tb"; import { FaLanguage } from "react-icons/fa"; import { personalInfo, contact, location, languages, workExperince as exp, skills } from "./importedInfo"; function App() { return (

{personalInfo.name.split(" ")[0]}
{personalInfo.name.split(" ")[1]} {personalInfo.name.split(" ")[2] || ""}

  • Title: {personalInfo.title}
  • Years of Experience: {personalInfo.yearsOfExperience}
  • Birthdate: {personalInfo.birthdate}
    Contact:
  • {contact.email}
  • {contact.website.replace('https://', '')}
    Location:
  • {location.address}
    Languages: {languages.map((lang, index) => (
  • {lang.language} {lang.level}
    • ))}

Work Experience:

{exp.map((ex, index) => (
{ex.startDate} {ex.endDate} - 
{ex.company}
{ex.location}
{ex.title}
{ex.description}
 ))}

Skills and Competencies:

{skills.map((domain, index) => (

{domain.title} {domain.level && ` - ${domain.level}`}:

    {domain.tools}
))}
); } export default App; ``` Don't forget to add this import at the top of your App.jsx file: ```jsx import React from 'react'; ``` This change migrates all the static data from App.jsx to importedInfo.jsx. Now you can easily modify the data in one place without touching the component rendering logic.
